website_summaries.verdict: The Eyefi Mobi Pro makes it easy to copy images from your camera to your phone or computer via Wi-Fi, and adds features that aren't in the standard Mobi.
pros: Choice of automatic or selective image transfer
Includes 1 year of Eyefi Cloud service
iOS, Android, and Windows Phone compatibility
Mac and PC desktop application support

customer_reviews.title: Poor Software - Difficult installation and still fails to work
customer_reviews.text: Item did not work in EOS80D Canon camera connecting to a PC, which it claimed it should do. The EyeFi download of software took numerous attempts to install with constant messages about a C+++2005 version causing problems, which wasn't the case. Looking at the website this is not an isolated case and so people should be wary about purchasing this device. I wanted something to do a job and it failed in this regard. I have returned it for a refund but still disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well!
customer_reviews.text: No problems setting up both on an iPad and Computer. We have used it both on the network created by the card - and also by getting the card to connect to the studio's network infrastructure, meaning the computer doesn't loose internet access. JPG files transfer in a matter of seconds, with RAW files (approx 25mb from a Canon 5Diii) the transfer takes around 20-30 seconds per image. It does drain a camera battery faster than a normal card - so make sure you have plenty of spares!
customer_reviews.author: Mugwump

customer_reviews.title: Great features
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to set up. Once app was installed and linked to camera, it took seconds to download the photo's. Well worth the money and the best feature was being able to view photos on a large screen to check them, and gives you the chance to play around with camera settings to get the best photo. You think you can see what the photo is like on the camera LCD, but until its downloaded you never know.
customer_reviews.author: Womble

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work consistently
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing when it works, but getting it to transmit a signal and actually transfer images is very fickle. I've tried all the trouble shooting available and sometimes I'm able to get it to connect by restarting/removing/resetting everything, but sometimes there is nothing I can do to get it to transmit (even in an area with no or few other WIFI signals). It can be extremely frustrating or really great, depending on the day. It's write speed is ok, though I notice it being slower than a similar CF card when used in my Canon 7D mark II.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wiens

customer_reviews.title: Great For Viewing Pictures On Your iPad
customer_reviews.text: This card worked a treat bringing up pictures on my iPad taken on my Fujifilm 100S camera while on holiday recently. Wife and daughter delighted that we could view the pictures so quickly. Only niggle and the reason for 4 stars is that I didn't find the Eyefi Mobi software particularly straightforward. Especially linking to iCloud and the 'free 1 year Eyefi Cloud' online services. So confusing in fact that I bought the 'Eye-Fi Pro x2 Extended User Guide [Kindle Edition]' to make sense of it all:
customer_reviews.author: BobHW

customer_reviews.title: Even with a compatible Sony camera and an iPad Pro I couldn't make it work.
customer_reviews.text: I've just spent over 10 hours trying to get this thing to work... No joy! The biggest confusion is caused by the fact that parts of EyeFi have been sold to a company called "Keenai". Next to no instructions come with the device, and an endless trawl through EyeFi, Keenai and YouTube pages, in the end, proved fruitless. I could not find a way to get my iPad Pro to even see this SD card.
customer_reviews.author: TerryM

customer_reviews.title: No upload without another device present at all times. Boo hoo!
customer_reviews.text: Reading the specs, I mistakenly thought the device would connect to home wifi and upload to the included cloud service without any other device involved. There has to be a device running the app about to do this. I might as well get an Android device to transfer the Mobi pictures to a free cloud service like Dropbox. So my challenge now is to keep a second device powered and connected to wifi for the long term project I had planned. Also, card seems much slower to write than what I usually use.
customer_reviews.author: Pimms w/o Mint

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my kit
customer_reviews.text: This card is great for my camera I don't bother using my other SD cards now, why should I when I can use this and get the pictures on my phone instantly!! Obviously it's more expensive than a standard 16gb SD card but it's honestly worth the buy. I've had no issues so far (I've had it 8months). Just please keep the orange activation card safe as you might need it more than once ( my mistake!)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but not as desired
customer_reviews.text: I find the product works as advertised but the process is cumbersome. The card cannot join an existing WiFi network and cannot make image files available in the way a network attached storage device can (no "Windows Shares" or similar). Instead, your PC must join the WiFi network hosted by this card (dropping its regular WiFi connection for that time) and can then obtain image files using special tools. The "Pro" feature to join an existing network requires helper applications on a Windows PC.
customer_reviews.author: w7

customer_reviews.title: Good option
customer_reviews.text: Really good option for previewing images from the shoot on your ipad or iphone. You can set up camera for storing your RAW files on a CF card and low res JPGS on this card. This way your transfer shouldnt take that long. Generally I would suggest shooting away and then reviewing images later. Otherwise you will spend half of your shoot waiting for the images to load. There are still some issues with connectivity. Connection between the card and ipad can suddenly drop. Overall it gives you an option to preview images on a bigger screen but definitely wont replace tethering to a computer. Very useful on smaller shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Potentially life changing!
customer_reviews.text: My first foray into the world of eye-fi cards and not disappointed. I had it set up in less than 5 minutes (literally) and I've been addicted to using it since! The transfers over to my iPad are really quick (based on medium or small jpegs) - it makes such a difference being able to review shots on a larger screen. The only frustration is my iPad reverting back to my home wifi network when the camera goes into standby, but I believe this can be remedied by configuring infrastructure support via the desktop app - something I still need to do. Anyway, in summary, a great bit of kit and the price is great for the tech!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Young

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This card works great! It gives my older Nikon DSLR the function of brand new much more expensive cameras. Great product to let people see what your shooting rather than having to keep showing people the back of your camera. Also good for remote trigger shooting so as not to disturb the shot you've setup. Works well with my iPad and iPhone enabling you to instantly share on social media.
customer_reviews.author: BL:)

customer_reviews.title: Check if it is compatible with your camera - Eyefi won't tell you!
customer_reviews.text: It is not compatible with Canon 5D mark II even with an SD to CF adapter. They don't tell you this and even when this became apparent it took me ages to discover which models it does NOT work with. Eyefi do not tell you this - they really should. I'm holding on to it until I get a 5D mark III or IV but right now it's a waste of money and I feel duped by Eyefi.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Millington

customer_reviews.title: Photo transfer made easy.
customer_reviews.text: A very useful addition to my Memory cards. Software was easy enough to set up on pc and Ipad. Put the card in the camera, take your photos and when you have your PC or Ipad switched on they automatically download to the Eyefi folder. No more taking the card out the camera, finding a card reader and uploading.
customer_reviews.author: Two O'Clock

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great if your camera does not have wifi capabilities. Will tether images to your phone or tablet wirelessly. Takes a little time to tether but most wifi transfer photo products do.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst products I've ever purchased - hasn't worked consistently or ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst products I've ever purchased - hasn't worked consistently or correctly once. Totally unuseable in a professional environment. Rarely connects to camera making transfers impossible. Network appears and disappears at random. Continually have to install the profile software on my phone and even then it rarely works. STEER CLEAR OF THIS PRODUCT. IT IS AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kwoon-Ming Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: It won't really sync pictures from my Nikon D610, but the app loves to sync pictures from my iPhone. So here I am getting a lot of useless pictures in the app while the ones that I want - well they are having super trouble to get synced. I really want to only sync from my Nikon, and I want to know what goes wrong because most of the time I can't get it to sync reliably. Also it gives me a "Card Error" very often that block my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Kimmer Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had great hope for this product, but after using it for two days I don't think I can rely on it. First off, when I was shooting, a couple of times my camera indicated a card error, secondly the speed of the card is pretty slow compared to my other sd cards. Finally I found the wifi connection a bit flaky. I am sure it will be ok for the casual user but not much good for a pro. Disappointed. I have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: pauladams

customer_reviews.title: But the app and sync as really good. Returned the product and bought a toshiba
customer_reviews.text: After a few days it start to crash a lot, a error message apear saying it “an error had occorred, not possible to save”. But the app and sync as really good. Returned the product and bought a toshiba, better hardware but the app is not that good.
customer_reviews.author: Homar Pereira Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for what I need. But it can be a bit slow at buffering. Plus my first one just died... so make sure you empty the card after every shoot. But customer service at Eyefi were brilliant and replaced my card for me.
customer_reviews.author: S King

customer_reviews.title: OK, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Item itself seems good, but transfer is slow from camera to my iphone, and very little (none) instructions on what to do or how to do it. App for my phone also gave no instructions. I have no idea on how to selectively transfer images from my camera to my phone and no idea where to go to find info.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Frankland

customer_reviews.title: Wifi on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent card. Very easy to set up & works great. I use this in my Canon 7D mk ii, raw files saved to CF & jpg saved to the Eyefi card. When out shooting, photos are copied immediately to my iPhone or iPad, which can then be reviewed on a larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: mcmilt

customer_reviews.title: After totally uninstalling and just used the basic functions it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with this at first as when I installed it I just clicked yes yes yes... and afterwards I couldn't turn off the default save to cloud option. After totally uninstalling and just used the basic functions it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Darrrell J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solution to sharing DSLR photography in an ever-sharing world. I've always had the issue of telling people my DSLR photos will be with them in a few weeks due to post-production on the Mac but now, I can instantly zap them to the iPhone and share in minutes. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: tabrez

customer_reviews.title: and the PC software doesn't do a very good job of syncing the latest photos
customer_reviews.text: A bit temperamental when connecting over WIFI, and the PC software doesn't do a very good job of syncing the latest photos. Having said, it does work eventually.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: What this card is good for: sending around 20-30 large JPEGS taken eg ...
customer_reviews.text: What this card is good for: sending around 20-30 large JPEGS taken eg over half an hour. Unfortunately I need it to shoot bursts of 5 images. The buffer filled up quickly meaning you had to wait 1 minute to view images on the camera back. The wifi link dropped out quite often even with camera and iPhone set to stay on.
customer_reviews.author: r j auckland

customer_reviews.title: Too unreliable to be useful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my D810 but it is too unreliable. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. No idea why and neither do any of my friends who have tried one. Such a shame as the concept is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Trev-R

customer_reviews.title: it works brilliant.. so much easier to capture From my
customer_reviews.text: This is the dogs nads.. once you have set it up.. it works brilliant .. so much easier to capture From my DSLR
customer_reviews.author: BITS

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a success!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item as it did not work well with my d5200 and an iPad, it was irregular and when contacted, the company advised me to return it and start again.
customer_reviews.author: jem

customer_reviews.title: Overcomplicated?
customer_reviews.text: Card is OK, ive found it more difficult to set up than the cheap Chinese equivalents though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not very good if your using this in a professional situation
customer_reviews.text: not very good if your using this in a professional situation, as the transfer is a little hit and miss. Samsung make a version of this and could be better, but not had a change to use it.
customer_reviews.author: CRB

customer_reviews.title: Helping to improve skills
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item helping me to practice with my new camera see the resulting pictures on my Samsung tablet . Hoping to improve my skill set .
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: this is the only choice.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied and I use it professionally now. seriously I don't understand why people complain for this eyefi. It works very good and also doesn't dry my DSLR's battery.
customer_reviews.author: konstantinos

customer_reviews.title: Eye see you!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good however if it is left on all the time then battery drain is rapid. Slightly annoying to turn on then link tablet etc to it but this is far outweighed by the flexibility this bit of kit gives you.
customer_reviews.author: Billy The Kid

customer_reviews.title: Latest Mibi Pro cards are great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with much improved flexibility of use and desktop software. There are improvements to the user guidance that could help more sophisticated use but good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great WIFI SD card.
customer_reviews.text: used in my Canon 60D. not the fastest SD but adequate for the job, transfer to the cloud/ phone / laptop
customer_reviews.author: Mike Freestone

customer_reviews.title: So simple to get started.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the Eyefi app, opened the package, input the card code, put the card in my camera, took photo and it instantly transferred to my kindle. Does what it says on the package. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: er9

customer_reviews.title: good but remain slow for large file
customer_reviews.text: it is very good and for smalls raw or better jpegs files but for large raw like 5d3's it is to slow exept you have a lot of time from frame to frame. as for video forget it, because after some minutes camera warning come up ,that your cart is to slow to write HD video .
customer_reviews.author: petros vittas

customer_reviews.title: It works a lot better the my previous Eyefi pro cards
customer_reviews.text: This is magic. It works a lot better the my previous Eyefi pro cards. Setup is better and transfer speed. It also seems to create its own wifi signal - which amaze's me.
customer_reviews.author: 3dcnc

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, saves loads of time moving pictures from camera to PC, Mac or iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cards working well
customer_reviews.text: The Eyefi mobi cards can not coexist with the old EyeFi Pro cards on the same computer, so when I bought 1 new card for my new camera, I had to replace the 2 old cards as well. Cards are working well and I now have 3 years subscription for the cloud storage. Sadly enough Eyefi is no longer providing automatic upload to Picasa/Google.
customer_reviews.author: Ib Nøhr Kristensen

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works perfectly in NikonD7100 and Panasonic TZ10
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works perfectly in NikonD7100 and Panasonic TZ10. Even transfers Raw files without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: qwerty

customer_reviews.title: great product, but the app is abusive
customer_reviews.text: one feature is very disappointing and prevents me from using this product - the app. it forces you to sync ALL photos on your design, which blocks the accounts. there is no option as of Dec 2016
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Worked first time on my Samsung Tablet , excellent product
customer_reviews.author: R.H.SEEDHOUSE

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 14 month use.
customer_reviews.text: The card start given errors after 14 month of use, so defintly happy with this card, which replaced and old Eyefi card, which also failed after 2 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Schmitto

customer_reviews.title: Works intermittently
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly but slowly on first use. Subsequently it has mind of it own and starts transfer intermittently. Not really suitable for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Glyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Easy to understand, easy to use, fast and reliable. I haven't had any problems using the eyefi mobi pro and would recommend to anyone who desires instant phone uploads from your camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I might have received a faulty card...
customer_reviews.text: Basically this card makes my 5D Mark III not firing up anymore. I have to reset the camera by removing battery and cards to make it work again. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LuckystarZ

customer_reviews.title: First yey, then ney
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially to sync photos from canon cam to iPhone but stopped working after a few weeks; camera could no longer write onto the card.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Faeh

customer_reviews.title: Was good when they used the old software now you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Was good when they used the old software now you have no choice but to use keenai and please don't waste your money this renders the card worse than useless. Be warned
customer_reviews.author: Ian B from barnstaple

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Already have several Eyefi Mobi cards for my cameras and I bought this one because I then can select and only send my best shot of RAW photos to my Eyefi Cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Sometimes I have to switch my camera off ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Sometimes I have to switch my camera off and on again to establish a connection to my phone/wifi but impressive and easy stuff none-the-less.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the product is working properly and we are satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says. Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use. I almost expected more setup time and teething issues...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... on my 5d mk 3 only thing I don't like is you can only use the card reader that's ...
customer_reviews.text: Works out of the box on my 5d mk 3 only thing I don't like is you can only use the card reader that's comes with the card
customer_reviews.author: glenn bryant

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at ALL costs
customer_reviews.text: Quite frankly the WORST product I have ever has the unfortunate experience to use - Eyefi really annoyed a number of their customers in 2016 with the removal of the ability to connect X2 cards directly to Wifi networks - This Mobi Pro was supposed to be better... it can't even connect to a local network and HOLD the connection... giving up with this company !
customer_reviews.author: earlyadopter

customer_reviews.title: Work needed on improving the software, otherwise ok
customer_reviews.text: Software let's this down - transfers OK from camera to my PC but problematic with my nexus10, but I think this is more of an issue with the nexus. Where this product is let down is the quality of the software - particularly transferring to the cloud. Once started the only way to cancel a transfer is to uninstall the software other than a pause which restarts when you switch off and back on again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr CL MACDONALD

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed and tested on MAC/PC
customer_reviews.text: If you are a MAC user and using an older OS version no point in buying this product, it's only ready to use with newest OS. No problem on PC/laptop but never purchased to use for this, also no need ro buy pro I think, not worth extra money. When tested on PC wasnt happy with transfer speed and I tested it on multiple devices. Made complaint to the manufacturer and they have not responded and I have been awaiting a reply several weeks now. So finally my previous purchase of EyeFi Mob, not pro was fine, but this one just using as an spare SD not happy with wifi capabilities
customer_reviews.author: K DJ Barnaby

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish- don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived next day, but didn't work. Returned it and a replacement arrived two days later. This one would not connect to my PC. Emailed EyeFi customer help desk who were a complete joke. Just sent me copies of the instructions whic I already had, and suggested I reinstalled it again. Still no good. Second one returned as well. Not impressed with the card or the customer service. Would definitely NOT recommend an EyeFi card to anyone. Now got a different wi fi card which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful SD Card which also transmits pictures to computer / tablet
customer_reviews.text: Still to get aqua tend to it but does as I expected saving my images on my iPad as backup / working copy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away! EyeFi is Out of Business.
customer_reviews.text: EyeFi is no longer in business by the looks of it. Their card tech has gone to Toshiba and their app is dead. You now use some other app called Keenai which is garbage. Keenai will grab 1yr of your mobile photos which you will then want to delete from Keenai. You can only do this by tapping each photo, no delete all function or to simply not import them in the first place. You have no choice but to activate your mobi subscription with Keenai to use the app. No photographer is interested is this Keenai service. Just Google Drive or Dropbox are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: SwiftInitiative

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on either of my nikon dslrs
customer_reviews.text: My first card was faulty but eyefi have replaced it without to much fuss. Much more complicated than the mobi cards but also much more useful. Can transfer raw files and you can choose which files to transfer. I use it on my nikon d810. Update. My second card is now giving me a card error in my d810 so it is looking less like a manufacturing fault and more like an incompatibility problem. If avoid if you have a nikon dslr (same problem in my d7000). Reading reduced.
customer_reviews.author: DR P.

customer_reviews.title: Do not by this rubbish
customer_reviews.text: I have had to review my first review . The item first sent was damaged another was dispatched and although the transfer speed is not great the item works just fine. I can get a better image review through my iapd to check for quality of light . not as quick as tethered capture, but as useful.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: This card only works if you have an Internet Connection -- TAKE GREAT CARE
customer_reviews.text: This card only works if you have an Internet Connection -- Jan van Hall Eyefi Customer Care gave me this response in response to my question "why won't my shots transfer when I am in the field without 4G coverage" -- the product description on both Amazon's site and Eyefi's own website (including all tech specs and FAQs that I have read) -- should have made it extremely clear that this card requires an active internet connection for the card to work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: AM

product_meta.title: Eye-Fi 32GB Mobi Pro WiFi SD 32GB SDHC Class 10 memory card

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars198 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
